characters: ALL BUILDING TO A HUGE CRESCENDO.
A FEW SECONDS OF BLACK, BEFORE...
DIFFERENT COLORS, COMPLETE WITH A CHOIR AND A CHURCH ORGA
CU PAUL, TALKING DIRECTLY TO THE CAMERA DOCUMENTARY STYLE
CRUMPLED CLOTHING. IN SHORT, HE'S A MESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a few seconds we watch A MAN (20s) and a WOMAN (20s) park bench. Their names are TOM and SUMMER. Neither one s a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON her HAND, covering his. Notice the wedding ring. words are spoken. Tom looks at her the way every woman wa to be looked at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DISTINGUISHED VOICE begins to speak to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a story of boy meets girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy is TOM HANSEN. He sits at a very long rectangular conference table. The walls are lined with framed blow-up sized greeting cards. Tom, dark hair and blue eyes, wears shirt under his sports coat and Adidas tennis shoes to balance out the corporate dress code. He looks pretty bor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy, Tom Hansen of Margate, New Jersey, grew up believing that he'd never truly be happy until the day he met his... "soulmate."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRE-TEEN TOM sits alone on his bed engrossed in a movie. walls are covered in posters of obscure bands. From the T we hear: "Elaine! Elaine!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This belief stemmed from early exposure to sad British pop music and a total misreading of the movie, "The Graduate."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is SUMMER FINN. She files folders and answers ph in a plain white office. She has cropped blonde hair almo like a boy's but her face is feminine and pretty enough t get away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl, Summer Finn of Shinnecock, Michigan, did not share this belief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teenage Summer stares at herself in the mirror. Her hair extends down to her lower back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the disintegration of her parents' marriage, she'd only loved two things. The first was her long blonde hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up scissors from the counter and begins to slic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second was how easily she could cut it off... And feel nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the right side of the screen, Tom continues to listen some boring presentation. On the left, Summer answers a c takes a message, and walks out of her cubicle down a long narrow hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom meets Summer on January 8th in a San Francisco office building. In an instant, he will know she's the one he's been looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU Summer opening the door to the boardroom, about to com face to face with Tom for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a story of boy meets girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before they do,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should know up front, this is not a love story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 12 year old GIRL rides her bicycle down the block. She arrives at an apartment complex, jumps off the bike and r up the front stairs. She rings the doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL and MCKENZIE open the door. These are Tom's best fri since birth. Paul is a doctor and wears hospital scrubs. McKenzie works in the cubicle next to Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know who else to call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girl removes her bike helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the right thing. Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is in the kitchen breaking things and basically going insane. About to smash a plate on the floor, he's interru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, put down the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom slowly obliges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now come here and sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sits next to the young girl. Paul and Mckenzie sit on either side of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key is not to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna be sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a glass of water. Tom drinks it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimacing at the taste) More.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gulps another down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Mom know you're here? It's gotta be past 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Start from the beginning. Tell us what happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer eat sandwiches in the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We spent the whole day together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer walk through the stalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer seated outside drinking coffee. He reads t newspaper, she reads a novel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer walk out of a movie theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw a film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer shop for music. Tom excitedly shows Summer Ringo Starr solo album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We bought music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was a great day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer in a booth ordering dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to WAITRESS) Um...you know what...let's go crazy, I'll have BOTH. (to Summer) God, I love eating pancakes at night. It's like the greatest thing ever. How great is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should stop seeing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she say why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing. This whatever it is. You and me. Do you think this is normal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Who cares about normal?! I'm happy. Aren't you happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we do is argue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is such a lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she was just in a bad mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hormonal thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.M.S.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) What do you know about PMS?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be a total surprise. I mean, we've been like Sid and Nancy for months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer, Sid stabbed Nancy seven times with a kitchen knife. We've had some disagreements but I hardly think I'm Sid Vicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I'm Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) So I'm Nancy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress comes out with the food. Tom and Summer stop their discussion until the meal is served and the Waitres leaves. Summer starts to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just eat and we'll talk about it after. I'm starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without another word she goes back to her pancakes. Tom watches her eat like this is the worst travesty in the history of mankind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Mmm, you're so right. These are great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks at his food in disgust. He may never eat again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INNOCENT) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stands up to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, don't. Come back. You're still my best fr---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence for a few beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's harsh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'm gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) I'm gonna throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom drinks more vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Hansen. You'll be ok. You're the best guy I know. You'll find someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they say...there's plenty other fish in the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure they do. They say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well they're wrong. It's not true. I've fished in that sea. I've jumped in and swam in that sea! I'm fucking Aquaman! (to Rachel) Sorry. What I mean is... there are no other fish. This was my fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and McKenzie share a very concerned look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks alongside his friend PAUL. Out of nowhere, he s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in love with Summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love how one eye is higher up on her face than the other eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love the scar on her neck from this operation she had as a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love how she looks in my Clash T- shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love how she looks when she's sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love the sound of her laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER BLACK, play the middle 8 of "Every Little Thing She is Magic" by The Police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love how I hear this song every time I think of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love how she makes me feel. Like anything's possible. Like, I don't know...like life is worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real, Paul. I'm madly in love with that girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is silent for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom as we saw him earlier. Bored. In the boardroom. Mcken is in mid-presentation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know this may be a little risque...but if New Hampshire Greetings wants the jump on those conservative, right-wing neo-Nazis at Hallmark, maybe playing it safe is the wrong approach. The nuclear family is dead and we need a new holiday to recognize that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mckenzie holds up a home-made photoshopped family portrai Martina Navratilova, Ellen DeGeneres, and the kid from "J Maguire".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May 21st. Other Mother's Day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The co-workers nod and digest this idea. VANCE is the hea the department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. That's an intriguing idea McKenzie. Along with Grossman's "Magellan Day" I'd say we've got some potential here. What do you think Hansen? Could you write up some prototypes for these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is about to answer when... the door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Vance? There's a call for you on line 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in walks this girl. Summer. We've met her by now but hasn't. This is the first time. His eyes go wide and from that moment on, he can't take them off her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the table) Everyone this is Summer, my new assistant. Summer just moved here from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Michigan. Well, Summer, everyone. Everyone, Summer. Excuse me, I have to take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer gives a little wave before following Vance out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't notice Tom whose face looks like he's just se God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom trying to work. And failing. He turns to McKenzie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we know about this new girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new girl. Summer. In Vance's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. I hear she's a bitch from hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DISAPPOINTED) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patel tried to talk to her in the copy room. She was totally not having it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she was just in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And maybe she's some uppity, better than everyone, superskank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. She's pretty hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes me so mad! Why is it pretty girls always think they can treat people like crap and get away with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, just cause she has high cheekbones and soft skin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and really good teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And maybe the world's most perfect breasts...Just cause of that stuff, she can walk around like she's center of the universe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as explanation) Women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. You know what? Screw her! We haven't even met and I can't stand her already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is listening to headphones. Summer enters the elevato and Tom actively puts on a show to ignore her. Summer hea the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Smiths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, pretending not to hear or care, gives her an unenthusiastic wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love The Smiths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, still pretending, takes off his headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said. I love The Smiths. You have good taste in music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as Tom processes this information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AMAZED) You like the Smiths?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SINGING) "To die by your side is such a heavenly way to die." Love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and she gets off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accidentally out loud) Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office sings "Happy Birthday" to a FEMALE CO-WORKER. they get to the part about her name, Tom is the only one knows it, everyone else just there for the cake. Song ove everyone digs in. Tom finds himself standing next to Summ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uh, Summer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! How's it going so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city or the firm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both... Either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy. Still getting situated. How long have you worked here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know, 4, 5... years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Jesus. Did you always want to write greeting cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nuts? I don't even want to do it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I studied to be an architect actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so cool! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, you know. Same old story. Moved to the city to work for a company. Company went under. Needed a job. My friend worked here. Got me this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And are you any good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to a framed card) Well I wrote that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUMMER (READING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Today You're a Man. Mazel Tov on your Bar Mitzvah."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a big seller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant, are you any good as an architect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... No. I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd say you're a perfectly ...adequate... greeting card writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why thank you. That's what they called me in college. "Perfectly adequate" Hansen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They used to call me "Anal Girl."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom does a spit-take and almost chokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EXPLAINING) I was very neat and organized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I should get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, well, I'll see you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks back to her cubicle at the other end of the hal Tom watches her walk away, completely enamored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down at his desk and sets out to work. But before does, his eyes fall on a sketch he drew of a house. It's dated 2001 and it's the only architecture sketch on his w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is playing Playstation with Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it turns out she's read every Graham Greene novel ever published. Her desk is lined with Magritte posters and Edward Hopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your favorites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're so compatible it's insane! Seriously! It doesn't make sense! She's not like I thought at all. She's... amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know...just cause some cute girl likes the same bizarro music you do doesn't make her "the one."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) Of course it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH, 50s, Tom and Rachel's mother, stands in the doorwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause and come eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do. Tom enters the living room area and sits down ne to his stepdad MARTIN, 60s, a quiet, professorial Souther gentleman type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON RACHEL and Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He met a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EXCITED) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GRIM) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah grows serious too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wright Brothers, Galileo, Heaven's Gate, Neil Armstro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When one strongly believes in something, it takes overwhelming contradictory evidence to change their minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE TOM, age 6, mesmerized by a vinyl album cover of Olivia Newton-John in "Xanadu."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom had always been a devout believer in the idea of "true love." (BEAT) The evidence did not support him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Tom stares at a LITTLE GIRL, 6, who has the same hairstyle and dress as Newton-John on that cover. Tom dra picture. It's a boy and a girl with a giant heart over th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up and walks over to the girl, putting the pict on her desk. Not a word is spoken. Satisfied, he returns his seat and waits to see what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhibit A: Lisa Rayner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Little Girl stands up and walks the picture over to ANOTHER BOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is mortified. The OTHER BOY eats the drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLONDE CHEERLEADER leads the crowd in a cheer. PAN ACRO to find TEENAGE TOM, 15, finishing making out with a home HIGH SCHOOL GIRL. He says goodbye and walks off, looking longingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhibit B: Wendy Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once Tom is out of frame, a SECOND BOY approaches Wendy. they start making out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLLEGE TOM sits next to his girlfriend REBECCA MYLES. Hi smile gleams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad we decided to go away together Bec. I know we've only been dating a few months but it's been...awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhibit C: Rebecca Myles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, you and me, 8 days in Mexico... best spring break ever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the aisle Rebecca makes eye contact with three COL DUDES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should see other people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Younger Tom sits in the passenger seat. Raven-haired AMAN drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, finally... Exhibit D: Amanda Heller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... it's complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's complicated? Last week you said you loved me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's sudden but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this can't be. Everything was going so great. I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts a disc into the cd player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're, like, the biggest music nerd I've ever met, I think this should really help explain where I'm coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pop song begins to play on the stereo. They listen for few beats. Tom is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember how much I loved this song when you first played it for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. It's all you wanted to listen to for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And I still like it, don't get me wrong. It's just... When I hear it now, I don't feel the same...rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still confused) Ok...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I press the skip button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still Tom doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this have to do with--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather listen to something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, it slowly sinks in for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Amanda... this is a great fucking song!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom removes his headphones and sits defeated with McKenzi and Paul in a booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it ever on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But it could have been. In a world where good things happen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, that's not really where we live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is alone. The door opens. In walks Summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there we are. All alone. Nine more floors to ride. Plenty of time. I figure...this is my chance. If not now when, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride in silence for a few beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) So how was your weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The friends wait for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe that shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I missed something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It was good." She didn't say "It was good." She said "It was good." Emphasis on the good. She basically said "I spent the weekend having sex with this guy I met at the gym." Fucking whore. Screw her. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you got problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not interested in me. There's nothing I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Based on..."it was good?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And some other things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what, she said "hey" instead of "hi" cause that totally means she's a lesbian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave her all sorts of chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom types at his desk. Summer approaches the cubicle Tom shares with McKenzie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the supply room. Anyone need anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you know what I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh ok, sure, no prob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is emptying out. Only a few people remain but and Summer are two of them. Tom takes this opportunity to a CD in his computer and play the song really loud. It's Want to Know What Love Is" by Foreigner. No reaction from Summer. Tom turns it up. Still nothing. Tom turns it down defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go out with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Summer says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Priest says, "But we're already out!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is hilarious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when she walks away, he smacks his head a few times w his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not once did she take the bait. Not once. Screw it. I'm done with her. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's friends all look at him like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sits at his desk with headphones on trying to work. B with Summer down at the end of the hall, he's having a ha time concentrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenzie shares a cubicle with Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Friday. 10 bucks all you can karaoke at The Well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way McKenzie. Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! (SINGING) "Take me down to the paradise city where the grass is green and they got big titties!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't let you back in there after last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. You just threw up on the stage, tried to fight the bartender, and then threatened to burn the place down before passing out on the sidewalk. Quiet night for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (REVERENTIAL) You saved my life that day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not going back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a work thing, Tommy. It won't be like that. The whole office is going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really can't. Even if I wanted to. There's a lot of stuff I gotta take care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not listening to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole office is going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks over to where Summer sits. And realization dawn him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer is in a back booth with some co-workers when Tom w in to the crowded place. McKenzie has the microphone and singing "Every Rose Has Its Thorn" by Poison. He's real i it and, well, it's kinda sad. Tom waves to McKenzie and w over to the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! They said you weren't coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked if I was coming? (BEAT) I mean...my plans got cancelled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is at a loss. There's yet another awkward silent beat between them. Thankfully, it's interrupted by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already drunk) Goddamn that song is brilliant! What's up Hansen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer sees the next song come up on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh that's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She downs a shot and jumps up on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic) Ok. I'm the new girl so no making fun of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her co-workers whistle and cheer her on. She takes a deep breath as the opening bars of "Born to Run" begin to play Summer starts to sing. Tom sees Summer as the actress in whatever nonsensical karaoke video accompanies the song ( something to do with an old convertible, the sunset, and midget in a tuxedo.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. Tom sits in the booth with McKenzie (doing a shot) Summer chats with co-workers at another table. Tom can't but stare at Summer. She notices and waves. He smiles, hopeful that she'll come over. She doesn't. He hides his disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. Tom walks back to his table with drinks. Summer is there in mid-conversation with McKenzie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great up there, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can't go wrong with The Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting down) I hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, did you know Tom here's from Jersey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lived there til I was 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I named my cat after Springsteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding? What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) That makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs. She's really cute when she laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you got a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom shoots daggers at McKenzie for that comment. McKenzie mouths "what?" Summer sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't really want one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. I don't believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe a woman could enjoy being free and independent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) Are you a lesbian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not a lesbian. I'm just not comfortable being somebody's "girlfriend." I don't want to be anybody's anything, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds selfish, I know, but... I just like being on my own. Relationships are messy and feelings are always getting hurt. Who needs all that? We're young. We're in one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUMMER (cont'd) I say, let's have as much fun as we can afford and leave the serious shit for later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...what if you meet someone and fall in love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS) Love? You seriously believe in that stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting. A real romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you have no idea. This one... embarrassing. There was this one girl, (to Tom) I gotta tell this story --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom elbows McKenzie hard in the ribs to shut him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer, hold on... you don't believe in love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know what that word means. I know I've never felt it, whatever it is in all those songs. And I know that today most marriages end in divorce. Like my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well mine too but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, And I read in Newsweek, there were these scientists who found that by stimulating a part of the brain with electrodes you can make a person fall in "love" with a rock. Is that the love you're talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, what's your take on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANIMATION SEQUENCE, real quick. AN EXPLOSION OF MANY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Tom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's...kind of a huge thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) Ok. Looks like we're gonna have to agree to disagree on that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenzie senses some discontent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uh, who's singing next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: singing) I'd say it's your turn loverboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo. I don't sing in public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do. I see you lip-synching to your headphones every morning on your way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok. I like it. Takes a lot of self-confidence to look ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't help himself) Self-confidence! Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom elbows him in the ribs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I'm not near drunk enough to sing in front of all these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok then. Let's drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would take at least ten shots to get me to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEN MINUTES LATER. Tom is up there singing The Clash's "Magnificent Seven." You wouldn't think so but Tom is a R STAR up there! He's dancing like Jagger, he's got everyon the bar singing along to the audience-participation parts It's a sight to behold. Summer is all smiles watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. Tom and Summer back at the table. Summer is hummin something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to watch it every week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Why can't we think of the stupid A-Team theme song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna bother me for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share another laugh and then it gets quiet. In that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON McKenzie, wasted, singing the shit out of "Proud Be an American." He really means it. At any minute he mig start to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And I'd proudly stand UP!" (aggressive drunk) I said stand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK ON TOM and SUMMER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom helps a nearly comatose McKenzie exit the place. Summ is with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Summer) This guy. (DRAMATICALLY) He's the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, let's get you in a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm gonna walk. I live right down that street. Or that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING) Is he gonna be ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab arrives. Tom and Summer help McKenzie inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you. You. (beat, to Summer) He likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (QUICKLY) Ok, goodnight McKenzie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean... likes you, likes you. For real. Tell her Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom shuts the door on McKenzie as fast as he can. Now it' just Tom and Summer. Tom talks a mile a minute to try and erase McKenzie's last exchange from her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry you had to see that. Happens every time we come here. It's unbelievable. Something about that guy and singing for people. I don't know. But at least he didn't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what. Do you...like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I like you. Of course I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. As a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as a friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheels are spinning in Tom's head. What's the right answer here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I mean... I haven't really thought about... Yes. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just... You're interesting. I'd like us to be friends. Is that ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom was clearly hoping for her to say something else. He hides his disappointment the best he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah totally. Friends. You and me. That's... perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm that way. Good night Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night Summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom watches her walk away for a beat before he turns to g the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Friends. Awesome. That's just great. Well done Hansen, you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks a few more steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, seemingly out of nowhere, without his even noticing, SUMMER HAS WRAPPED HER ARMS AROUND HIM AND PULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's unbelievable. There's a few seconds where Tom isn't if he's dreaming or not. But then he realizes, suddenly, of the blue, his best case scenario really is actually happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP: "YOU MAKE MY DREAMS COME TRUE" by Hall and Oates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the greatest morning of all time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks down the street. Or, more accurately, Tom strut down the street. He's pointing at people as he passes, winking, doing a little shuffle. He is the man. He checks his reflection in a window. A YOUNG PAUL NEWMAN stares ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People wave as he passes, they clap, they give him thumbs A parade forms behind him. The POSTMAN, a POLICE OFFICER, HOT DOG VENDOR, RONALD MCDONALD and MAYOR MCCHEESE, every loves Tom today. HALL and OATES themselves walk with Tom singing the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars stop at crosswalks to let Tom go by. The DRIVERS als pump their fists in celebration of Tom's achievement last night. He walks on, the man. We notice the sidewalk light every time he touches the pavement like in "Billie Jean".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTOON BIRDS fly onto Tom's shoulder. He smiles and wink them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom passes Summer's office whistling Hall and Oates. She him and immediately lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance pokes out of his corner office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer, I need -- Oh hello Hansen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mr. Vance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Vance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're all business. As Tom turns to go, however, Su gives him a little coy smile that would be enough to make anyone's day complete. Tom gives her the international si for `I'll call you later' in return. Vance sees none of i Tom walks to his cubicle, still on top of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom answers the door. It's Paul (in hospital scrubs).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks inside without waiting for an invite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night, karaoke night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ANXIOUS) Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same girl you'd been whining and crying and bitching about for weeks now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have not been...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same girl you said was way out of your league and you'd have no chance with no matter what. That girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, seriously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bang her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Paul, no jobs. I'm still unemployed. We just kissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, level with me. As your best friend, who tolerated a whole month of talk talk talk about this girl, nothing but Summer this, Summer that, Summer Summer Summer, I mean you were practically stalking her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the sound of a toilet flushing is heard. From t bathroom emerges Summer, dressed to go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Summer..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer, wow what an unusual name. I'm sure I'd remember that if I had heard it before. Tom, how come you've never mentioned you knew such a lovely little lady? (off Tom's nasty look) Or perhaps you have and I've just forgot. (to Summer) I mean, with all the women in Tom's life it's hard to keep track... (not helping) Ok, well, I was just... I'm Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not sure what else to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I'm leaving now. Pretend I was never here. Tom, talk to you later?... Hey, If any jobs open up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom quickly shuts the door on Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. You ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm stalking, STARVING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom realizes she's heard it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PLAYFULLY) He exaggerates!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer eating, not really talking much. At anothe table, Tom sees a VERY UNATTRACTIVE COUPLE feeding each o food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer sees. She has no reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SARCASTIC) That is hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer keeps eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very turned on right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes you can be so judgmental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, who are you? They're happy. Just mind your own business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer goes back to eating. Tom can't believe she snapped

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An equally UNATTRACTIVE COUPLE go at it in a booth. PAN ACROSS to find Tom and Summer early in their relationship a booth across the room, watching in hysterics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too soon to say. It's all in the dismount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're lucky, there won't be a dismount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer, her cheeks flushed already from laughing, loses i again. They are having a great night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe them. I have like zero patience for PDA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear ya. If I want to watch people make out, I have big windows and binoculars at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) No. That would be wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh some more. She is in hysterics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fun. You're fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I just want to say, up front, I'm not looking for anything serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is a little surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you cool with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (UNCONVINCING) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It freaks some guys out when I say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still confused) Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just have fun. Let's just...hang out, no pressure, no labels, no obligations. (BEAT) Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is visibly disappointed by this but he tries to hide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) Wanna hold my hand under the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer and Tom come bounding in, lip-locked and all over other. They fall on his bed and begin undressing each oth Suddenly, Tom stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be...back in a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks into the hallway, out of her sight. He looks int the hallway mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Settle. Don't get too excited. She's just a girl. There's lots of them. Who look like that. And like what you like. They're everywhere. Calm yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a few deep breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you calm? (BEAT) Ok. Then it's time to go back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch from behind as he re-enters his bedroom. Where Summer waits. Under the covers. Naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sweet Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom can't help but do a little celebration dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. Sex has been had. Summer is asleep. Tom lies next her. He still can't help but be ecstatic. He is pumping h fists in the air and silently shouting "Woo Hoo!!!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into CAMERA) I fucking hate Summer.
