dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm all done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what... Sometimes you really don't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks out. He looks back but she isn't looking. When looks back at him, he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. Tom about to leave the office. Passes Summer's des She's on the phone. He wants to stop and say something bu she's busy. He walks on. She never knew he was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. Summer, packed up to go, walks over to Tom's cubic but he's already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left: Tom tosses and turns in his sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right: Summer lies awake, staring at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left: Tom picks up the phone. Is about to dial when he st himself and hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right: Summer looks at her phone, willing it to ring. It doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is awakened by a buzzer. He hits the "sleep" button b the buzzing isn't coming from his alarm. It's his door. H gets up, concerned, and goes to answer it. It's Summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say you're sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say you're sorry for acting like a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I'm sorry for acting like a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer... we don't have to label what we're doing. I just... I need -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consistency. I need to know you won't wake up tomorrow and feel a different way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't promise you that. Nobody can. Anyone who does is a liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can only tell you how I feel right now... or I can show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes in and kisses him. He thinks about it for a sec Is this enough to assuage his doubts? Damn it, she wins again. He shuts the door in our faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer in the wee hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever had a real "boyfriend?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boyfriend. "Going steady." Whatever. You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause there's nothing to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'm interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna have the relationship history conversation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Yeah. I don't know. Why not? I can take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Well, in high school, there was Markus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: Still photograph of MARKUS. Or at least how he appears in Tom's mind. Arm cocked, about to throw the win touchdown pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quarterback slash homecoming king?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a rower. Very hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Markus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works for the Republican party. Very successful. Just not for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. And then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for a short time in college, there was Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: Still photograph of KURT. As Tom envisions him. Playing the guitar on stage in Motley Crue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That didn't really go anywhere. (BEAT) And... my semester in Rome. Daniele Belardelli. AKA "The Puma."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: Still photograph of THE PUMA. A swarthy Italian posing in front of a Vespa moped in tight Gucci pants, hi boner clearly trying to escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Puma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, cause, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom has no idea. And he doesn't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ones that lasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Why didn't they work out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened really. It's what always happens. Life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On TOM. Silent for a few beats. Did he want to hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, unshaven, un-showered, walks by himself. He turns a corner and sees Summer walking towards him. As she gets closer he sees it's not her after all and breathes a sigh relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom watches TV. An advertisement for toothpaste comes on. could swear the actress was Summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trolley going the other direction passes by. EVERY PASSENGER ON IT IS SUMMER. Tom is a fucking mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and an attractive girl we haven't seen before walk towards an outdoor cafe. Her name is ALLISON. It's clear right away that Tom can't wait for this night to end alre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how long have you known Paul and Robyn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since grade school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, really? That's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm glad you called. They spoke very highly of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Alison eat. In silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...uh... how's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been pretty quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty quiet too. Usually. It's nice sometimes to be comfortable enough that you can just sit and eat and not have to say anything, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to try some --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison looks at her food. Tom realizes he's been difficul starts to feel kinda bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's just... there's this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not usually like this. I wasn't before... Long story short, she wrecked me. I don't know if you can tell but it was pretty recent and I'm still kinda thinking about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DISAPPOINTED) Well maybe you should think about... someone else... who could cheer you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get her out of my head, you know? I see her everywhere. She's all I think about. And it's horrible. Cause I totally didn't see it coming. I thought things were fine. So now I keep going through every day in my mind, every second really. Wondering. What went wrong? Is it my fault? Could I have prevented it somehow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer and Tom stand on the street corner looking at the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people have problems with this, but to me, it makes both structures so much more beautiful side by side like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom keeps talking. Summer turns and looks directly at the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you continue to talk about buildings and whatever other bullshit interests you, I'll just nod my head and pretend to listen while secretly dreaming about the many ways I can one day rip out your heart and eat it like the rabid vampire I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Alison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there were things I could have said or done, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the scene in which Tom and Summer first slept togeth He's sleeping like a baby, probably the best sleep he's h in a long while. Summer lies next to him. Wide awake. Bor and unfulfilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Alison. Alison is desperately trying to get a dri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or... Christ, I don't know, maybe she was never that interested in me to begin with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer ride in silence for a few beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) How was your weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winks at him) It was good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway... sorry. If I'm acting strange, that's why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok. I'm sure it's tough getting over an ex-girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually she was never my girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Alison is really confused. And it's right around the where Tom starts totally cracking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... I thought I'd have figured it out by now, you know? My life. Where I'm going, where I want to end up, who with. All that stuff. I still don't know anything. And the thing is... When I was with Summer, none of that mattered. I never even noticed how much of my life was missing! Isn't that weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in love, that's what it does. But, now that you know where the holes are you can start to fill them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (BEAT) Hey, I've been talking non-stop. You talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Well I grew up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think? Did I do something? Did I not do something? What can I do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALISON (cont'd) You wanna get out of here? I know this great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly excited) Oh! You know what we should do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is, yes, on stage singing another song by The Clash, "Train in Vain." Not so much singing as having a nervous breakdown to music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You said you'd stand by your man!/So tell me something I don't understand. You said you loved me!/And that's a fact! And then you left me, said you felt trapped!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison sits by herself in a booth trying to hide her face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You didn't stand by me! Not at all! You didn't stand by me," I'm talking about you Summer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Alison, having the worst date ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is getting dressed for a big fancy night out. A punki pop song plays in the b.g. that he occasionally boogies d to. He's excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tucks his shirt into his pants. He ties his tie. He brushes his teeth with aplomb. He looks for, finds, and plucks a grey hair from his head. He makes some faces int the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied, he grabs his coat and hits the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walking in the Spring air, feeling good. The phone ri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer on the cell as she enters her apartment. She looks like she's coming back from the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello me. You having a good day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am thank you. Listen, about tonight... I think I might just stay in and go to bed early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just really tired and I've gotta go in early tomorrow. Would you be super mad at me if we went out this weekend instead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... You don't want to just, maybe, go to dinner. I mean, you've gotta eat right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not really that hungry. And this place is fancy right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching his tie) Sorta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather not. Seriously, do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is standing still now, no longer moving. He's trying keep his frustration from being audible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no, that's cool. Whatever you want to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. So we'll talk tomorrow, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Good night Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Happy... birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the line is dead. Tom's head sinks into his chest. Ye another frustrating night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got lucky I guess. We met in elementary school. We had the same class schedule in the 7th grade and we just... clicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love? Shit, I don't know. As long as she's cute and she's willing, right? Actually, cute is a strong word. Not atrocious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a pretty complex question. Philosophers, poets, scientists, everybody has a theory, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL (cont'd) I kinda like what Nietzsche said: "There is always some madness in love, but there is also...always some reason in madness." Think about it. Pretty smart. Although, Nietzsche also said "Kill the Jews." So there's that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been happily married for 30 years. She's the light that guides me home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is from one of our cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No someone else wrote it. Doesn't make it less true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok I'm sick of this love shit. Come on! We've been fed this nonsense for generations to the point where it's now genetically encoded in our very beings. And what does it mean? Absolutely nothing. Give me a break!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying... I really need some ass. I'm desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say "the girl of my dreams," no. The girl of my dreams would have a better rack. Probably different hair, could like sports a little more. But... truth is... Robyn's better than the girl of my dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why? Cause she's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says nothing. Just stands there. So confused. We go ri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANIMATION. A QUICK 5 second recap of the earlier color sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is wandering through the office whistling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hansen, don't you have like twenty bar mitzvah cards to write?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. All done. What are you working on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. But I've run out of ways to say it. "Good job," "well done," "way to go"... I got nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you try... "Everyday you make me proud. But today, you get a card."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) Shit. That's not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No worries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks by the room marked "Weddings and Anniversaries. He's about to keep going when he pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the people who work in here are MIDDLE AGED WOMEN. Currently, they are standing around one desk where Tom si writing everyone's cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good Millie. "To my wife, the love of my life. I love you." That's very nice. I was thinking though, why not try something like... "Everyday that we don't meet is meaningless and incomplete." You know, spice it up a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Women clutch their heart like they might faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers are again all gathered around Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you try... "Merry?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa/Perfect/Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom says something totally in Yiddish. No one knows what hell he just said except for one Employee who bursts out tears of joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom passes Summer at her desk. She waves. He waves back. so in love with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON TOM writing furiously at a computer terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...aint no woman got what you got, sista girl. Happy birthday to the lean, sheen, and sizzly mocha queen!" (BEAT) How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AFRICAN-AMERICAN MAHOGANY WRITERS are impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's gotten into you son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer in line to buy tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to see this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's, like, all stabbing and shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you take me to are sappy little romances. I want to see some open wounds, damn it. I want carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Tom sees something at the front of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here they come, Tom's mom and step-dad, Sarah and Mar Tom's face registers a noticeable panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Martin are delighted at this coincidence. Sarah hugs and kisses her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Summer) Hi Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer smiles. Maybe this will be ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, Martin, this is Summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer! Well hello! We've heard so much about you! It's so good to finally meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah hugs Summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Martin weighs in with his own hug. Tom notices Summer's face growing increasingly concerned. Why is he hugging me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tom) Is this the girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is caught like a deer in headlights. What can he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this is the girl friend I've told you about. I don't know if "girlfriend" is the right word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to see the serial killer one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! Should we save you seats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, this has become incredibly awkward for Tom and for Summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. We'll see you inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they're out of earshot, Tom sees that Summer is distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna go do something else? We can totally bolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell them I was your girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! No way... I never used that word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They seemed to think... I mean, why is your step-dad giving me a hug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very...loving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he hug all your friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's that word again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer looks at Tom, like she's disappointed or even angr him for something. Then she walks ahead of him into the theatre. He's forced to follow. Answer-less, as conflicte ever. Why is none of this easy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer, Tom, Sarah, Martin in a row. Summer's face is col emotionless. Tom tries to look at her, to make eye contac something. She knows he's looking but it doesn't make her head turn his way. Tom gives up and watches the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON THE MOVIE SCREEN. We see a BLACK AND WHITE FILM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a MAN racing down the street, fleeing from an unseen assassin. When he turns around we see the man is TOM. Bul fly and he's hit repeatedly in the back while running awa like Belmondo in BREATHLESS. He dies an elaborate, violen horrible on-screen death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rave music blares. Tom stands off to the side looking miserable. Summer is on the dance floor. Though she's not really dancing with anyone in particular, she's dancing w everyone. Finally she comes over, white shirt dripping wi sweat and clearly a little high on one thing or another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not having any fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're having enough for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dancing. I haven't danced in ages. God. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! I wanna dance with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you an hour ago? I might have danced then. I've been standing here by myself this whole time and you didn't look over once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're pissed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not pissed. Summer... you know I hate this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you wanted to do so...we're doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, I didn't need a chaperone. Go home. You're a buzzkill standing there pouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (HURT) That's real nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off. She feels some guilt for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when he doesn't turn around she just shakes it off an starts dancing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. Tom is outside in the rain. We can still hear the music blaring from the club. Summer is in there. Tom is alone. He can't believe it's come to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP: "YOU MAKE MY DREAMS COME TRUE" by Hall and Oates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst morning ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks down the street. Or, more accurately, Tom sulks down the street. Though it's sunny and warm, Tom is a sad broken man and the world is an awful place. There's still Hall and Oates following Tom, almost trying to cheer him He checks out his reflection in a window. Ron Howard's brother Clint looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks by a COUPLE making out on a bench. He grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks by a sign that says "TODAY ONLY: FREE BEER." He doesn't even stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cartoon Bird returns but Tom swats it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WORLD'S MOST BEAUTIFUL WOMAN stops to ask him for directions. He doesn't even look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's parade of supporters, The Postman, Mayor McCheese, of them shake their heads and give him disapproving looks The Cartoon Bird takes a cartoon shit on Tom's shoulder. tries to kill the bird. Can't even manage that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes Summer desk on the way in. She's no longer ther He miserably sits down at his desk, tries to work but he up just staring into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom has been called into the Principal's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me, Mr. Vance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Hansen. Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has something happened to you recently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A death in the family, someone taken ill...anything like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't mean to pry. Does this have something to do with Summer leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faking badly) Your...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom...everyone knows. Nevermind. The reason I'm asking... lately your work performance has been... a little off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For example, here's something you wrote last week... (reads from a card on his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Roses are Red, Violets are Blue. Fuck You Whore." Now...most shoppers on Valentine's Day ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vance... are you firing me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Relax Hansen. You're one of our most... adequate writers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Well, I'm sorry. Things for me have been a little difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ok. I understand that. I was just thinking... perhaps you could channel your energy into... this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands him some sympathy cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funerals and sympathy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Misery, sadness, loss of faith, no reasons to live... it's perfect for you. Whaddaya say? Good? Good. Now back to work you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly ushers him out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom wakes up. He gets his bearings and then quickly rolls onto the floor and begins a brief push-up routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most days of the year are entirely unremarkable. They begin and they end without creating a single lasting memory. Most days have no real impact on the course of a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. Tom stops his push-ups to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May 8th was a Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks in to find Paul and McKenzie at a table. They l extremely nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither one answers him. They look at each other. Finally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I want to hear it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thats what we wanted to ask you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just...lately you've been...better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been much much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So maybe it's best we don't ever bring her up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let sleeping dogs lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave those dogs alone Tom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys, look, I'm... I appreciate what you're saying and, thank you, really, for putting up with me these past few months. I've been crazy. But I've accepted the fact that she and I were just two very different people who wanted very different things. I wanted to get serious. Shit, I loved her. And I know now, she just isn't the kind of girl who can settle down with one person and be happy. The way I wanted. And she probably never will. There was nothing I could do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mckenzie and Paul just sit there. Now more uncomfortable ever. On Tom, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom comes charging out of the place with his friends following behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no fucking way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be. It's impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Tom's pained face we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is going apeshit in his room. He's ripping down poste taking pictures out of frames and tearing them apart. He punches the wall. He drinks an entire bottle of red wine. tries to find something to kick and can't. He throws his phone off his balcony. Finally he collapses on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The half-destroyed alarm clock goes off. Tom hits the off button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same exact thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, in a robe and boxer shorts, buys milk, OJ, cigarette Jack Daniels, and twinkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLERK eyes him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sees a COUPLE kissing on the sidewalk. He winces. He ANOTHER COUPLE entwined on a bench. It's killing him. He a THIRD COUPLE walking towards him holding hands. He snap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ people! Get a room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at this lunatic in his robe and quickly walk aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarm clock. We PAN ACROSS to see Tom is wide awake. He probably hasn't slept in a day or so. He has no reaction the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom actually wanders in to work, wearing sunglasses and t clothes he slept in. People pass and say hello. He can't muster responses. At his desk,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been calling every five minutes. Are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh yeah. Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twinkies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out of twinkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go... where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sits next to McKenzie and across from Vance. He's in usual boardroom position, which is to say, near comatose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A female CO-WORKER, 50s, stands at the front of the room mid-presentation, showing slides that have something to d with a cat in various poses. First we see, "Cat Reaching for Out-of-Reach Milk Bowl."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one says "Go for it!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clicks to the next slide. "Cat Hanging From Tree Bran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one says "Don't give up!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click. We see "Cat Considering a Giant Leap."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this one says "You can do it!" We have a whole line of inspirational cards featuring Pickles, my cat. I think people will really enjoy them. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job Rhoda, I agree. Really inspirational stuff. Now, who's next. We haven't heard from "Sympathy" in a while. Hansen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacting to his name) Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Winter collection. You have anything to contribute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...no. I really don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I wouldn't say nothing... Actually, that's about right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DISAPPOINTED) Oh...k. We'll come back to you. McKenzie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I say something about the cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well sure. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This here is, and Rhoda, you know I mean no disrespect... but this... this is total shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Don't give up?" "You can do it?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the screen, still showing the "Cat About to Leap" image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't inspirational. It's suicidal. He tries that jump, I'm writing a sympathy card for that cat. That's the last thing I want to be doing with my life. It's bad enough writing these things for people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hansen, this is a place of business. We don't cut down our co- workers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cause we're liars! It's what we do here. Why don't we level with people? Stop feeding them nonsense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a greeting card company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes but think about it! Why do people buy these things? Not to say how they feel. There's paper and pens for that. People give these cards when they can't say how they feel. Or they're afraid to. And we provide the service that lets `em get away with that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is getting excited. The rest of the room is growing uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say to hell with it! Let's level with America. Or at least make them speak for themselves! I mean, seriously, what's this... (picks a card off the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'm sorry to hear your grandmother has passed." What the hell? Let's give em some truth. Something like, "Sorry to hear about your grandmother. Here's a card so I get some credit in your time of need. I'm sure it makes up for the fact that grandma's dead."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vance and the card-writing team are appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it. (picks up another card) "Congratulations on your new baby." Eh... How bout... "Congratulations on your new baby... Guess that's it for hanging out. Nice knowing ya, buddy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hansen, sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up a card) Wait, what's this? Ooh... fancy! Look at this one with all the hearts. Let's open it up. "Happy Valentine's Day, Sweetheart. I love you." Oh that's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If someone gave me this card, Mr. Vance... I would eat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom recognizes he's losing his shit. He takes a seat on t boardroom table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) It's these greeting cards, Sir, these cards, these movies, these pop songs. They're responsible for all the lies, the heartache, everything! We're responsible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone shifts in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we do a bad thing here. People should be able to say how they feel, how they really feel, without some strangers putting words in their mouths. The truth. A card is a nice thought but it shouldn't do the dirty work for you. You love someone, tell them yourself, in your own words. Maybe it's not love at all. Maybe there's no such thing as love. Maybe it's... "galoogoo." (BEAT) Yeah I made it up, so what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom gets up and walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all crap. We make and peddle crap. And sometimes people believe in this crap. I just can't do it anymore, Mr. Vance. There's enough bullshit in the world without my help. I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that he gets up and walks off. The room is prett stunned. Someone coughs. McKenzie tries to start a clap. doesn't really take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom comes outside with some boxes. He stands out in front the building. His face says one thing. "Holy shit. Did I do that?!" And then we,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and his friends on the sidewalk outside the deli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no fucking way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be. It's impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... It's May! We broke up last August.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you said she was single at Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now she's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she's getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible. It doesn't make sense. Where did they meet? Is it someone we know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So everything she said. All that stuff about... it can't be. Not her. I know her too well. She wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His friends say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that he storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Tom walking away from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Literally, his entire universe falls apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FX: BUILDINGS come crumbling down. The whole city turns t rubble. He's the only constant as the world around him is ERASED, brick by brick, beam by beam, as if by an unseen force and reduced to nothing.

dialogues.text: And we fade up those famous OPENING BARS OF "HAVA NAGILA.

dialogues.text: CU on a CIRCLE OF PEOPLE HOLDING HANDS, some young, some Tom right in the mix trying hard to smile. Has he joined cult?

dialogues.text: I can't believe that. No girlfriend?

dialogues.text: TOM

dialogues.text: AUNT BETSY

dialogues.text: TOM

dialogues.text: No. Where's that coming from?

dialogues.text: So how's work?

dialogues.text: Of course. Where am I exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. So this is a big day in your sister's life.

dialogues.text: Pretty big, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why aren't you smiling?

dialogues.text: Hey brother. Wanna dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You having fun? You were great this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah yeah. Talk to me. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I'm good. I'm great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Summer's engagement) I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's silent a few beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, who cares about me? This is your day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him. Tight. He doesn't cry but he could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, my friends... they're all in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I tell ya? There are plenty other fish in the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are guppies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows, someday one might turn out to be your "true love."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you making fun of me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got news for you Rach. That true love stuff... it's make-believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's not very romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the new me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... go play with your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LYING) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you think she was the perfect girl for you... (BEAT) I don't. I think you're just remembering the good stuff. But what do I know, right? I'm 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blows him a kiss and then runs off and joins her girl Tom watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is wide-awake, sitting fully dressed on his bed putti his shoes on. He holds the phone up to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.text: Summer is half-asleep under the covers. The phone lays at side and she angles towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10:30. Are we still hanging out today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you at Liberty in... 20 minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might need 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer are having a picnic. If it looks familiar, it's cause we saw them here on page 7. This is that fatef day Tom described to his sister and his friends. The day all, finally, fell apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how was last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was fine. Just a work thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you guys go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uneventful. Didn't get home until after 12 though which is way too late for a stupid work function. How was your night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty standard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much more to say. Stay with them for a few extra beat silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer shopping at the fruit market. Unless we we looking for trouble we wouldn't see any. But since we are might notice she lags behind him as they walk through the aisles. His hands are in his pockets. He's bored. She's distant. But only if we're really looking.

dialogues.text: Tom, almost with a full beard, is redecorating his apartm again. We see him rearranging the furniture in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That day again. As we've seen before, Tom reads a newspap Summer reads a novel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's playing at 5.

dialogues.text: You want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You wanna maybe go back to your place or ---

dialogues.text: I want to see it. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I will. That's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few more silent beats. Something's in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Summer watching the film. Tears begin to well in Summer's eyes. They soon turn to audible sobs. Tom turns look at her, to offer some sort of comfort, believing it be a response to the movie. She doesn't look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom drawing a straight line on his wall. Redecorating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the line he's drawn. He extends it a little b He draws another. He begins to furiously draw on the wall From out of nowhere, inspiration has hit. An image starts form. A pretty impressive looking futuristic skyscraper, almost shaped like a tear drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same day from the past. They walk out, at first everythin alright. It's exactly as we saw on page 7. But soon after that she begins to cry again. Serious, real sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to hug her. He hugs her. It's unclear if she hugs back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Sum, it's just a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm sorry Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything alright with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, tries to pull herself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm just...I'm sorry. I'm being ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok. This happens to me every time I watch "Hoosiers." Let's go for a walk, ok. Let's get some air. Or go to Sister Ray's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk.

dialogues.text: Tom and a much more in control Summer walk down the aisle He grabs one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It pains me that we live in a world where no one's ever heard of Spearmint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never heard of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's painful. Oh look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a Ringo Starr album and shows it to her, just as we've seen on Page 7. She smiles and they continue on dow the aisles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In CU, Tom goes to hold Summer's hand. But something happ It could be a total coincidence, but just as his hand approaches hers (in SLO-MO), she moves it away and keeps at her side. Tom puts his hands in his pockets, unsure if there's something to read in that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sketches intensely. The landscape, the skyline, the works. He's in the zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, that fateful day continues. Tom and Summer outside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now...I think I'm gonna call it a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? You wanna maybe...get some dinner or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got pasta at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty hungry, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a great idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pancakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer's resistance is futile. And the rest as they say i history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP: "Number Two" by the Pernice Brothers. Which play

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom shaves. Makes himself look presentable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. Tom, now clean shaven and looking like he did when first met him, sketches on his bed with one hand while holding a phone with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sits on a street corner drawing new additions to the city's skyline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sits with his feet up on a table, headphones on his e reading one of many Taschen books on innovative building design.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom drops off his portfolio with the security guard in th lobby of a high-rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and his mom and step-dad cheer on his sister playing soccer. It's a nice temporary distraction for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom getting bad news on the phone. He has a list written his wall (which is now composed of a dynamic cityscape of futuristic looking structures). He crosses "Abrams and Abrams" off the list. We notice several others are also crossed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom has his car on the side of the road and is out measur the distance between the beams of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom jogs. A little faster this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom getting more bad news from the answering machine, crossing off yet another firm from the list. Few remain. sits on the bed with his shoulders slumped. For a beat, l in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, as if to shut those thoughts out, whatever they wer he turns on the TV and joylessly watches the nothingness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the LEFT, Tom, alone, on a bus. Looking out the window Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the RIGHT, Summer. In her wedding dress. The veil is lifted. And she's a bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, in a suit, exits a building after another dismal interview. We can see he is frustrated but not deterred. the distance, his favorite spot in the city, where he too Summer ages ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks over and sits down on a bench. He stares off, l in thought. And then, from out of nowhere, there's her vo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer sits like an apparition on a neighboring bench. Sh may have just sat down, she may have been there for hours Tom isn't sure if she's real. He doesn't quite know what do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: suit) Where you coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh. Nowhere. How long have you been sitting there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom finds it hard to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come here a lot. I always loved this place, ever since you brought me here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mention of their past makes the atmosphere frosty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... I should probably say congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably. But only if you mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I do honestly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well...anyway...I hope you're happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BEAT) God no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh a little. The tension begins to dissipate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, Tom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. Ish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I quit the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? That's great! What are you doing now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mostly...sleeping. Breaking things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, my guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Wait. Don't tell me. I don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More awkward silence. This one goes on a beat longer. And

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing to me. You're married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not only someone's girlfriend, your someone's wife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty crazy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SIGHS) I'll never understand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's different now? How could things change so quickly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?! That's what I don't get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... Tom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I woke up one day and I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I could promise him I'd feel the same way every morning. In a way that I... I never could with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's not much else to say after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what sucks? Realizing that everything you believe in is complete bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny, soulmates, true love. All that stuff. It's nothing more than silly childhood fairy tale nonsense, isn't it? God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, don't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have listened to you, Summer. You were right all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer takes a beat to let this hang there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, out of nowhere, she begins to hysterically laug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? This is funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tries to stop but it only makes it worse. Now's she's completely cracking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you laughing at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she can't stop. She's totally lost control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying himself not to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a crazy person!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom! You're the crazy person!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day I'm reading a book at the corner deli and this guy sits down and starts asking about it. Now he's my husband!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is funny to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would have happened if I went to the movies instead? If I went somewhere else for lunch? If I showed up to eat ten minutes later? Tom, it was meant to be, just like you said. And as it was happening, I knew it. I could feel it, sure as the sun. And I kept thinking to myself "Holy shit. Tom was right." You were right about all of it. (BEAT) It just wasn't me you were right about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is speechless. Summer takes his hand. We may notice h wedding ring. We may also notice that this is the same ex shot as the first scene of the screenplay. We hold it for few seconds more. And then, the hands separate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I should probably be getting back. It was good to see you. I'm glad you're well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer gets up and starts walking away from him. After a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops and turns back. He takes in her face, most like for the last time ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really do hope you're happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she walks away. The CAMERA TRACKS AWAY with her, leav Tom alone in the park, getting smaller and farther away e second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, in a suit, with a hefty batch of architecture sketch at his side, waits in the foyer of Allen, Prince, and Get Architecture. From the room we can tell this firm is big time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We notice, before he does, a VERY CUTE GIRL sitting in a another chair, also waiting. She smiles. He smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you here to interview?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you interviewing? For the position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Why, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. My competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, this is a little awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope you don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh. There's a silence for a few beats. And i during this time that something weird comes over Tom and can visibly see it in his face. He likes the look of this girl. This girl is cute. He'd like to talk more with her. And, honestly, he's a little surprised by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you from...California?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grew up not too far from here. Atherton, near Stanford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Atherton. Nice area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I seen you before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, don't know. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you go to St. Patrick's? Not to pray or anything but to stand outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do! I love that church. It's like my favorite structure in the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only it wasn't near that horrible mirrored thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Exactly. I totally agree!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (BEAT) I think I've seen you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have? Really? Hmm. I didn't see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens. You probably weren't looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Hansen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to go. But halfway through the doorway, he paus and looks back at the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Tom had learned anything... it was that you can't ascribe great cosmic significance to a simple earthly event. Coincidence. That's all anything ever is. Nothing more than coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANIMATION. 1 second clip of the colored sequence. Real fa Hardly noticeable. But it's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took a long time but Tom had finally learned. There are no miracles. There's no such thing as fate. Nothing is meant to be. He knew. He was sure of it now. (BEAT) Tom was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...pretty sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Girl) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this is over... uh... would you like to maybe...grab a cup of coffee or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I'm sorta supposed to meet someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DEFLATED) Oh. Got it... No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back around and shakes that off, tries to refocu the task at hand. A job interview. And then he hears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! So... I'll wait for you here, or you wait for me or...something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs. She's cute when she laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok! (extends hand to shake) My name's Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts out her hand to meet his. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Autumn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CREDITS ROLL TO "GO ASK YOUR DAD" by THE TYDE)
